column3: and free (on certain days that is).  It's a great place to visit and check out some pretty well known pieces of art.  There are so many different rooms to see and the architecture alone is a sight to see.  It's a wonderful way to spend an afternoon
column4: alone or with a group of friends.  It's real close to Millenium Park
column5: so if you're trying to check out everything in Chicago
column6: stop in after checking out the Bean.  Tons of great photo opps inside.  If you really want to appreciate all the artwork inside you'll have to devote a good amount of time at the Art Institute.
